intro: Agallostachys variegata, commonly known as the variegated agalloch, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking variegated leaves that display shades of white, yellow, and green. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Agallostachys variegata is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique foliage and pleasant scent.
